mid.name: No Escape
mid.trigger: A creature within the brute's reach moves away from the brute
entries: The brute Strides up to their Speed, following the foe and keeping it in reach throughout this movement.

bot.name: Brute Strength
entries: Abendego brutes deal an extra {@dice 2d8} damage with tridents, and a trident gains the {@trait shove} trait while the brute is using it in melee (both the extra damage dice and the {@trait shove} trait are included in the fighter's fork {@action Strike||Strikes} above).

bot.name: Restrain
entries: When the jailer makes a successful mancatcher {@action Strike}, their target must succeed at a {@dc 27} Reflex save or become {@condition grabbed} until the end of the jailer's next turn.
Each time the target fails an attempt to {@action Escape} the jailer, it takes {@damage 2d6} piercing damage.

bot.name: Subduing Attack
entries: Abendego jailers deal an additional {@damage 3d6} precision damage to creatures that are {@condition frightened} or within reach of at least one of their allies. The jailer can make an attack with this additional damage as a nonlethal attack, if they choose.

mid.name: Sodden Defense
mid.trigger: An attacker misses or critically misses the Abendego priest with a melee {@action Strike}
entries: The priest calls upon the endless storm to punish the attacker. Seawater appears in the target's lungs and the target is {@condition sickened||sickened 1} ({@condition sickened||sickened 3} if the triggering attack was a critical miss).

bot.name: Sneak Attack
entries: The Abendego priest deals an additional {@damage 2d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.

bot.name: Steady Spellcasting
entries: If a reaction would disrupt the priest's spellcasting action, they attempt a DC {@flatDC 15} flat check. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

mid.name: Deny Advantage
entries: Ajbal isn't {@condition flat-footed} to creatures of 13th level or lower that are {@condition hidden}, {@condition undetected}, flanking, or using surprise attack.

mid.name: Evasion When
entries: Ajbal rolls a success on a Reflex save, he gets a critical success instead.

mid.name: Nimble Dodge
mid.trigger: Ajbal is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker he can see
entries: Ajbal gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

bot.name: Hunt Prey
entries: Ajbal designates a single creature he can see and hear, or one he's Tracking, as his prey. Ajbal gains a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Perception} checks to {@action Seek} his prey and {@skill Survival} checks to {@action Track} his prey. The first time Ajbal hits his designated prey in a round, he deals an additional {@damage 2d8} precision damage.
Ajbal also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within the second range increment when attacking his prey. These effects last until Ajbal uses {@action Hunt Prey} again.

bot.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Ajbal deals an additional {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.

bot.name: Tear the Wound
bot.requirements: Ajbal's last action was a melee {@action Strike} that dealt sneak attack damage to a {@condition flat-footed} target
entries: Ajbal deals 6 {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} to the target creature, and the target is {@condition enfeebled||enfeebled 1} for as long as it's bleeding.

bot.name: Trident Bully
entries: A trident Ajbal is using gains the {@trait shove} trait, and any creature Ajbal critically hits with a trident is {@condition flat-footed} until the start of Ajbal's next turn.

creature.name: Bharlen Sajor
items: heavy crossbow (20 bolts and 2 storm bolts [as storm arrows])

mid.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When Bharlen is destroyed, her armor rebuilds her body over the course of {@dice 1d10} days—or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host (see Graveknight Armor, Bestiary 191). If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts. Bharlen can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating her armor (such as with disintegrate), transporting it to the Positive Energy Plane, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

mid.name: Sacrilegious Aura
entries: 30 feet.
When a creature in the aura uses a positive spell or ability, Bharlen automatically attempts to counteract it, with a +18 counteract modifier.

mid.name: No Escape
mid.trigger: A creature within Bharlen's reach moves away from her
entries: Bharlen Strides up to her Speed, following the foe and keeping it in reach throughout this movement.

bot.name: Brute Strength
entries: Bharlen deals an extra {@dice 1d8} damage with tridents, and a trident gains the {@trait shove} trait while she is using it in melee (both the extra damage die and the {@trait shove} trait have been included in Bharlen's trident {@action Strike||Strikes} above).

bot.name: Devastating Blast
entries: Bharlen unleashes crackling lightning in a 30-foot cone. Creatures in the area take {@damage 6d12} electricity damage ({@dc 30} basic Reflex save). Bharlen can use this ability once every {@dice 1d4} rounds.

bot.name: Sodden Strike
entries: Bharlen calls to the endless storm to lend murderous power to her blows. She makes a {@action Strike}; on a hit, seawater appears in the target's lungs and the target is {@condition sickened||sickened 1} ({@condition sickened||sickened 3} on a critical hit).

bot.name: Graveknight's Curse
notes: This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour

stages.entry: {@condition doomed||doomed 1} and can't remove the armor
{@condition doomed||doomed 2}, hampered 10, and can't remove the armor
dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight

bot.name: Ruinous Weapons
entries: Any weapon or unarmed attack Bharlen uses gains the effects of the +1 greater striking and greater shock weapon runes.

bot.name: Weapon Master
entries: Bharlen has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapon she wields.

mid.name: Breath of Silt
entries: 30 feet.
A creature that begins its turn within the area feels as if its lungs are filling with silt and must succeed at a {@dc 25} Fortitude save or be unable to speak or breathe.
The creature can still hold its breath and can attempt a new saving throw at the end of its turn. A creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to breath of silt for 24 hours.

mid.name: Rise Up
mid.trigger: A creature walks on top of the bog mummy amalgamation lying buried in the silt below
mid.requirements: Initiative has not yet been rolled
entries: The bog mummy amalgamation notices the creature automatically and Burrows before rolling initiative.

bot.name: Bog Rot
entries: This affliction can't be reduced below stage 1, nor can the damage from it be healed, until it's successfully treated with remove curse or a similar effect; the affliction can then be removed as normal for a disease. A creature killed by bog rot melts into a noxious sludge and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-level resurrect ritual or similar magic

bot.name: Fist Flurry
entries: The amalgamation makes two fist {@action Strike||Strikes} against two different targets within its reach. Its multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

bot.name: Sneak Attack
entries: A boggard hunter deals an additional {@damage 2d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.

bot.name: Swamp Stride
entries: A boggard hunter ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} caused by swamp terrain features.

bot.name: Terrifying Croak
entries: The boggard unleashes a terrifying croak. Any non-boggard within 30 feet becomes {@condition frightened||frightened 1} unless they succeed at a {@dc 25} Will save; those who critically succeed are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

bot.name: Tongue Grab As Grouloop, but
entries: AC 22 and 7 damage.

mid.name: Brutal Recovery
mid.trigger: The cyclops bully fails (but does not critically fail) an attack roll or an {@skill Intimidation} check
entries: The cyclops bully forces its will on an array of possible futures. It gets a success on the roll instead of a failure.

bot.name: Terrorizing Swing
entries: The cyclops bully attempts to {@action Demoralize} a foe within its melee reach, then makes a melee {@action Strike} against that foe. If the creature is {@condition frightened} and takes damage, it takes an additional {@dice 2d10} damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. This counts as two attacks toward the cyclops's multiple attack penalty.

top.name: Ritual Conduit
entries: Golgopos were created to assist with complex rituals. The golgopo can always use {@skill Occultism} to attempt secondary checks during rituals, regardless of the skill normally required. If a golgopo would critically fail a secondary check, they fail instead.

mid.name: Warning Call
mid.trigger: A creature targets a {@condition flat-footed} ally within 10 feet of the golgopo
entries: The golgopo has a premonition of the attack and shouts a warning to their ally.
The ally gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

bot.name: Portents of Doom
entries: The golgopo unleashes a wailing cry that heralds impending disaster. Each creature within 30 feet must attempt a {@dc 26} Will save. Golgopos and cyclopes are immune to this effect.

Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and temporarily immune for 1 minute.
Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened||frightened 2} and {@condition confused} for 1 round.

bot.name: Soul-Shaking Croak
entries: Grouloop utters a powerful croak that deals {@damage 6d10} sonic damage to any non-boggard within a 30-foot emanation ({@dc 27} basic Fortitude save). A creature with the {@condition frightened} condition that fails its saving throw increases its {@condition frightened} condition by 1 (on a critical failure, the creature is also {@condition fleeing} for as long as it is {@condition frightened}). Grouloop can't use Soul-Shaking Croak again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

bot.name: Swamp Stride
entries: Grouloop ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} caused by swamp terrain features.

bot.name: Tongue Grab If
entries: Grouloop hits a creature with her tongue, that creature becomes {@condition grabbed}. Unlike with a normal grab, the creature isn't {@condition immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of Grouloop's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue by hitting AC 24 and dealing at least 9 slashing damage. Though this doesn't deal any damage to the boggard, it prevents her from using her tongue {@action Strike} until she regrows her tongue, which takes a week.

mid.name: Resolve When
entries: Halbrux rolls a success on a Will save, she gets a critical success instead.

mid.name: Flash of History
mid.trigger: Halbrux is about to attempt a skill check
entries: Halbrux peers into lore of the past and increases the level of success by one step (for example, a success becomes a critical success).

bot.name: Curse of Torrential Knowledge
entries: When halbrux uses her revelation spells, her mind fills with a flood of disorienting information. The first time Halbrux casts one of her revelation spells in a day, she takes a –4 penalty to initiative rolls until the next time she makes her daily preparations. The second time Halbrux casts one of her revelation spells in a day, she is also {@condition flat-footed} until the next time she makes her daily preparations.

bot.name: Predictive Blows
entries: Halbrux identifies the immediate movements of a creature she can see and attempts a {@skill Lore||Fortune-Telling Lore} check against that creature's Reflex DC. On a success, Halbrux's melee {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an additional {@damage 4d6} precision damage ({@damage 6d6} precision damage on a critical success) to the creature until the end of Halbrux's turn.

bot.name: Quickened Casting
entries: If Halbrux's next action is to cast a cantrip or a 4th-level or lower spell, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum of 1 action).

bot.name: Steady Spellcasting
entries: If a reaction would disrupt Halbrux's spellcasting action, she attempts a DC {@flatDC 15} flat check. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

creature.name: Ixamè

top.name: Mist Vision
entries: Fog and mist don't impair a cloud dragon's vision; Ixamè ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from fog and mist.

mid.name: Frightful Presence
entries: 90 feet, {@dc 26}

mid.name: Deflecting Cloud
mid.trigger: Ixamè is the target of a ranged attack
mid.requirements: Ixamè is aware of the attack and has a free wing
entries: Ixamè rapidly flexes one of her wings and creates a billowing cloud of mist.

She is treated as if she were {@condition hidden} for the purposes of resolving the triggering attack, so normally the attacker must succeed at a DC {@flatDC 11} flat check to target her. Ixamè also gains a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

bot.name: Breath Weapon
entries: Ixamè breathes a cloud of poison like that emitted from

bot.name: Terwa
entries: Lake that deals {@damage 11d6} poison damage in a 40- foot cone ({@dc 29} basic Reflex save). She can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

bot.name: Cloud Walk
entries: Ixamè can tread on clouds or fog as though on solid ground.

bot.name: Draconic Frenzy
entries: Ixamè makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one horn {@action Strike} in any order.

bot.name: Draconic Momentum
entries: Ixamè recharges her Breath Weapon whenever she scores a critical hit when making a {@action Strike}.

creature.description: Female poison-wracked young cloud dragon (Pathfinder Bestiary 2 89)

top.name: Poison Sense
entries: A karumzek senses any poisoned creature. It can spend an action with the {@trait concentrate} trait to determine the poison's type and current stage.

bot.name: Change Shape
entries: A karumzek can take the shape of a Tiny spider. This doesn't change its Speed or {@action Strike||Strikes}.

top.name: Poison Sense
entries: As karumzek.

bot.name: Swarming Bites
entries: Each enemy in the karumzek swarm's space takes {@damage 2d6} piercing damage ({@dc 27} basic Reflex save) plus karumzek venom.

bot.name: Karumzek Venom
notes: Stage {@damage 6d6} poison, {@condition clumsy||clumsy 2}, and {@condition enfeebled||enfeebled 2} (1 round)

creature.name: Norgorberite Spy
items: religious symbol of {@deity Norgorber}; one spy carries a greater cognitive mutagen and the other carries a vial of slumber wine
but the labels on each are switched.

top.name: Ranged Feint
entries: When the Norgorberite spy successfully {@action Feint||Feints} a creature, the target is {@condition flat-footed} against the spy's ranged attacks as well as melee attacks.

mid.name: Reaper's Protection
mid.trigger: The spy is about to attempt a saving throw
entries: The spy touches their religious symbol of {@deity Norgorber} and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to the triggering save.

bot.name: Quick Draw
entries: The Norgorberite spy {@action Interact||Interacts} to draw a weapon, then {@action Strike||Strikes} with that weapon.

bot.name: Sneak Attack
entries: The Norgorberite spy deals an additional {@damage 4d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures or creatures within reach of at least two of their allies.

bot.name: Surprise Attack
entries: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are {@condition flat-footed} to the Norgorberite spy.

mid.name: Orc Superstition
mid.trigger: Onyiji is about to make a saving throw against a spell or {@trait magical} effect
entries: Onyiji gains a +1 circumstance bonus to the triggering save.

bot.name: Spellstrike
entries: Onyiji casts a spell and couples it with a staff {@action Strike}. She casts produce flame, ray of frost, or shocking grasp, but the effects don't occur immediately. She makes a melee {@action Strike} with her staff and uses the attack roll result as the effect of both the {@action Strike} and the spell. This counts as two attacks towards her multiple attack penalty, but the penalties don't apply until after the {@action Spellstrike|SoM}.

bot.name: Twisting Tree When
entries: Onyiji wields a staff in one hand, it gains the {@trait agile} trait and its damage die size increases to d6 (these adjustments are reflected in the {@action Strike} above). When she wields a staff in two hands, it gains the parry, {@trait reach}, and {@trait trip} traits. She can {@action Interact} to {@action Release} or change her grip on her staff as a free action

top.name: Site Bound
entries: A screaming sulfur becomes bound to the location where the people whose souls make up its form died.
It can stray up to 1,000 feet from this site of death, or up to 100 feet from the edges of any waterway associated with its death, whichever distance is shorter.

mid.name: Agonizing Cries
entries: 30 feet. The screaming sulfur constantly shrieks with the pained wails of countless spirits. A living creature that enters or starts its turn in the aura must succeed at a {@dc 26} Will save or become {@condition frightened||frightened 1} as long as it remains in the aura ({@condition frightened||frightened 2} on a critical failure). A creature that succeeds is temporarily immune for 1 hour.

mid.name: Rejuvenation
entries: Blessing the site where the screaming sulfur was formed and burying whatever dead remain allows the spirits within the screaming sulfur to move on to the afterlife, rendering it inert.

bot.name: Choke
entries: The screaming sulfur bombards all creatures within its Agonizing Cries aura with visions of death and a feeling of suffocation. Each creature takes {@damage 4d6} mental damage ({@dc 26} basic Will save).

resistances.name: all damage
resistances.note: except force, {@item ghost touch}, or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical

top.name: Deluge Vision
entries: A ssumzili ignores sensory difficulties caused by rain.

top.name: Precipitation Camouflage
entries: A ssumzili can {@action Hide} and {@action Sneak} in rainfall, even if it doesn't have cover.

mid.name: Standing Water
entries: 10 feet.

When it rains, the ground near a ssumzili becomes slick. When raining, all terrain within 10 feet of a ssumzili is slippery, with the effects of grease ({@dc 29}). Ssumzilis are immune to this effect.

bot.name: Puddle Stride
entries: A ssumzili ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} caused by rain, such as puddles or wet rocks.

bot.name: Sneak Attack
entries: A ssumzili deals an additional {@damage 2d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.

bot.name: Soaking Strike
entries: The ssumzili makes a melee {@action Strike}. If the {@action Strike} damages the target, the target must also attempt a {@dc 32} Fortitude save.

Success: The creature becomes soaked, causing them to treat the environmental temperature as one step colder (mild to severe, severe to extreme, and so on; Core Rulebook 517) until they dry off.
Failure: As success, and the creature is {@condition fatigued} for 1 minute.
Critical Failure: As failure but the fatigue lasts until the target gets a full night's rest.

creature.name: Terwa Chosen
items: +1 striking returning mambele (Pathfinder Lost Omens Gods & Magic 120)

top.name: Deep Breath A
entries: Terwa chosen can hold their breath for 10 minutes.

mid.name: Born Lucky
mid.trigger: The Terwa chosen rolls a success or a critical failure on a check
entries: The Terwa chosen improves the triggering roll by one degree of success, only from a success to a critical success or from a critical failure to a failure.

bot.name: Celestial Might
entries: The Terwa chosen calls upon the stars to empower their attack. They attempt a {@action Strike}. If the {@action Strike} hits, the Terwa chosen deals an additional {@damage 2d6} precision damage.

bot.name: Champion's Star
entries: The Terwa chosen looks to the sky for a star to guide their attack. The Terwa chosen gains the effects of true strike.

top.name: Deep Breath
entries: A terwa prodigy can hold their breath for 10 minutes.

top.name: Deep Breath
entries: A Terwa star reader can hold their breath for 10 minutes.

mid.name: Move the Stars
mid.trigger: An attack or effect would reduce an ally within 30 feet to 0 Hit Points or would cause the ally to gain the {@condition dying} condition
entries: The star reader interprets the meaning of astrological omens in an instant, determining a new fate for the ally. The triggering ally remains at 1 Hit Point, does not increase their {@condition dying} or {@condition wounded} condition, and gains 10 temporary Hit Points for 1 round.

bot.name: Guiding Star
entries: The star reader finds the star that would guide their own attack or that of an ally. The star reader grants themselves or an ally within 30 feet the effects of true strike. If the star reader chooses an ally, the duration lasts until the end of that creature's turn. The target is then temporarily immune to Guiding Star for 1 day.

mid.name: Halfling Luck
mid.trigger: Thiarvo fails a skill check or a saving throw
entries: Thiarvo rerolls the triggering check and must use the new result.

bot.name: Fighting Rod
entries: Thiarvo's rod of wonder is supple wood and can be used as a fighting stick (Pathfinder Lost Omens Mwangi Expanse 86). It can be enchanted with fundamental runes but not property runes, and it's currently enchanted with the +1 and striking runes.

bot.name: Lethal Fighter
entries: Thiarvo can make lethal attacks using weapons with the {@trait nonlethal} trait without taking the usual –2 penalty. His attacks with weapons with the {@trait nonlethal} trait deal an additional {@damage 2d8} precision damage, whether he's making nonlethal attacks or lethal attacks with them. This damage is included in his melee entry.

bot.name: Slippery Halfling
entries: Thiarvo ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} from trees, foliage, rubble, and undergrowth.

mid.name: Cat's Luck
mid.trigger: Yonsuu fails or critically fails a Reflex saving throw
entries: Yonsuu rerolls the saving throw and takes the better result.

bot.name: Hampering Strike
entries: A foe that takes damage from Yonsuu's melee {@action Strike} is {@condition slowed||slowed 1} for 1 round ({@condition slowed||slowed 3} if the {@action Strike} is a critical hit).

bot.name: Subduing Attack
entries: Yonsuu deals an additional {@damage 3d6} precision damage to creatures that are {@condition frightened} or within reach of at least one of his allies. Yonsuu can choose to make an attack with this additional damage as a nonlethal attack.
